details.explication: Each HTTP request consumes energy and slows down loading. Reducing the number of requests by combining CSS/JS files and eliminating unnecessary resources improves performance and reduces environmental impact.
commentFaire: Use 'WebPageTest' to analyze the number of requests
Test with 'GTmetrix' to identify unnecessary resources
Analyze with 'Chrome DevTools' → Network to see all requests

exemple.html:
<!-- Combined CSS -->
<link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.min.css">

<!-- Combined JS -->
<script src="app.min.js"></script>

<!-- Avoid multiple requests -->
<!-- ❌ To avoid -->
<link rel="stylesheet" href="header.css">
<link rel="stylesheet" href="footer.css">
<link rel="stylesheet" href="main.css">
exemple.description: Example of reducing requests by combining files

details.explication: The total weight of a web page (HTML, CSS, JS, images) directly influences its energy consumption. A lightweight page loads faster, consumes less bandwidth and reduces environmental impact.
commentFaire: Use 'WebPageTest' to measure the total page weight
Check with 'Lighthouse' → Performance → Total page size
Test with 'GTmetrix' to analyze weight distribution
Analyze with 'Chrome DevTools' → Network → Total transferred

exemple.description: Example of light vs heavy page for eco-design

details.explication: Tracking scripts (analytics, advertising, social networks) can represent up to 50% of a page's JavaScript. Eliminating unnecessary trackers improves performance and respects user privacy.
commentFaire: Audit your scripts with 'Chrome DevTools' → Network
Test with 'WebPageTest' to see the impact of third-party scripts
Analyze with 'Request Map' to visualize trackers

outils.description: Analyze third-party scripts in the Network tab
Visualize all domains contacted by your site

<script>

items.label: Use system fonts or local fonts

details.explication: External web fonts (Google Fonts, Adobe Fonts) add HTTP requests and can slow down loading. Using system fonts or hosting fonts locally improves performance and reduces environmental impact.
commentFaire: Use 'Font Squirrel' to generate your webfonts
Check with 'Chrome DevTools' → Network for font requests
Analyze with 'WebPageTest' to measure font impact
